results.title: An International Multicenter Cohort Study on beta-Blockers for the Treatment of Symptomatic Children With Catecholaminergic Polymorphic Ventricular Tachycardia.
results.text_hl: The HR of the secondary outcome was only higher in @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ compared with @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@ (HR, 2.68 [95% CI, 1.30-5.55]).

citations.NLM: Peltenburg PJ, Kallas D, Bos JM, Lieve KVV, Franciosi S, Roston TM, Denjoy I, Sorensen KB, Ohno S, Roses-Noguer F, Aiba T, Maltret A, LaPage MJ, Atallah J, Giudicessi JR, Clur SB, Blom NA, Tanck M, Extramiana F, Kato K, Barc J, Borggrefe M, Behr ER, Sarquella-Brugada G, Tfelt-Hansen J, Zorio E, Swan H, Kammeraad JAE, Krahn AD, Davis A, Sacher F, Schwartz PJ, Roberts JD, Skinner JR, van den Berg MP, Kannankeril PJ, Drago F, Robyns T, Haugaa K, Tavacova T, Semsarian C, Till J, Probst V, Brugada R, Shimizu W, Horie M, Leenhardt A, Ackerman MJ, Sanatani S, van der Werf C, Wilde AAM. results.title: Pheochromocytoma associated ventricular tachycardia blocked with atenolol.

results.title: Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by atenolol.
results.text_hl: A therapeutic response, defined as the minimum percentage reduction in @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@ventricular arrhythmias@@@ to demonstrate an effect due to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ rather than spontaneous variation, was achieved in up to 70% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ for total number of @DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ectopic beats@@@, 75% for ectopic couplets, and 73% for @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ beats.

citations.NLM: Heng MK, Zimmer I. Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by atenolol. Am Heart J. 1985 Jun;109(6):1273-80. PMID: 4003239
citations.BibTeX: @article{4003239, title={Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by atenolol.}, author={Heng MK and Zimmer I}, journal={Am Heart J}, volume={109}, number={6}, pages={1273-80}}

results.title: Atenolol for ventricular ectopy: a dose-response study.
results.text_hl: The results indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ is more effective in suppressing @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ than in suppressing overall @DISEASE_Andersen_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D050030 @@@ventricular ectopy@@@.

citations.NLM: Fenster PE, Reynolds D, Horwitz LD, Morrison D, Goldman S, Thadani U, Lazzara R, Serokman R, Marcus FI. Atenolol for ventricular ectopy: a dose-response study. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1987 Jan;41(1):118-23. PMID: 3802701
citations.BibTeX: @article{3802701, title={Atenolol for ventricular ectopy: a dose-response study.}, author={Fenster PE and Reynolds D and Horwitz LD and Morrison D and Goldman S and Thadani U and Lazzara R and Serokman R and Marcus FI}, journal={Clin Pharmacol Ther}, volume={41}, number={1}, pages={118-23}}

results.title: Atenolol, but not mexiletine, protects against stimulus-induced ventricular tachycardia in a chronic canine model.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@, but not @CHEMICAL_Mexiletine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008801 @@@mexiletine@@@, protects against stimulus-induced @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ in a chronic @SPECIES_9615 @@@canine@@@ model.

citations.NLM: Uprichard AC, Harron DW. Atenolol, but not mexiletine, protects against stimulus-induced ventricular tachycardia in a chronic canine model. Br J Pharmacol. 1989 Jan;96(1):220-6. PMID: 2924074
citations.BibTeX: @article{2924074, title={Atenolol, but not mexiletine, protects against stimulus-induced ventricular tachycardia in a chronic canine model.}, author={Uprichard AC and Harron DW}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={96}, number={1}, pages={220-6}}

results.title: Intravenous atenolol for ventricular arrhythmias.
results.text_hl: Thus, a single intravenous dose of 10 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ can significantly reduce the frequency of @DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ventricular premature complexes@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ within the first hour after infusion; suppression can last for 7 hours.

citations.NLM: Morganroth J. Intravenous atenolol for ventricular arrhythmias. Am J Cardiol. 1986 Sep 1;58(6):499-502. PMID: 3529912
citations.BibTeX: @article{3529912, title={Intravenous atenolol for ventricular arrhythmias.}, author={Morganroth J}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={58}, number={6}, pages={499-502}}

results.title: [Effectiveness of atenolol in moderate arterial hypertension. Evaluation by stress test].
results.text_hl: A study on the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on exercise blood pressure is presented.

results.title: Effects of atenolol in patients with reciprocating supraventricular tachycardia.
results.text_hl: We studied 12 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with crisis of @<m>DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@paroxysmal reciprocating supraventricular tachycardia@@@ before and after intravenous injection of 5 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Pimenta J, Pereira CB. Effects of atenolol in patients with reciprocating supraventricular tachycardia. Clin Cardiol. 1986 May;9(5):191-5. PMID: 3708945

results.title: Atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia initiated by catecholamine-induced ventricular tachycardia. A case report.
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was effectively treated with a combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@.
